Key Match Events: Zack Kelly allowed five runs in the top of the ninth, and Boston's offense went 0 for 6 with runners in scoring position.
Richard Fitts pitched into the sixth inning and allowed two unearned runs on six hits and a walk with two strikeouts over 5.2 innings.
Connor Wong hit a solo shot for his 13th home run of the season in the second inning.
Masataka Yoshida walked and Connor Wong singled to put two on with no outs in the fifth inning, but neither came home to score.
Casas let a line drive by Zach DeLoach go under his glove for a two-base error to start the sixth.
Andrew Benintendi hit an RBI groundout to give Chicago a 2-1 lead.
Korey Lee followed with an RBI single to give Chicago a 2-1 lead.
Abreu tied the game with a solo home run with two outs in the sixth.
Dominic Fletcher gave Chicago the lead with his go-ahead RBI double in the top of the ninth.
Jacob Amaya and DeLoach each singled to extend the lead to 6-2 in the top of the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Alex Cora said the Red Sox had to take care of business this weekend against the woeful Chicago White Sox to give themselves a realistic shot at making the playoffs.
The Red Sox won the series, but Sunday they let perhaps the best opportunity to gain ground they’ll have slip away.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Alex Cora said the Red Sox just didn’t finish the ninth inning.
Manager Alex Cora praised Richard Fitts for his performance and said there were two plays that stood out to him.
Manager Alex Cora said Zack Kelly's poor outing boiled down to “lack of execution” and that he needs to become more consistent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Red Sox are now one game over.500 at 72-71 with 19 games to play.
Next up is the Orioles, who come to Fenway Park seeking to solidify their own position amid a heated battle for the AL East championship with the Yankees.
